Jo likes the Wispa Bites. 2. The person with the Hamster likes Swimming. 3.Hannah eats Dairy Milk. 4. The person who likes Wispa Bites lives next to the person who wants to go to Florida. 13.The person who likes Pink wants to go to Florida. 14. The girl who likes Crunchies owns a Rabbit. 21. The girl who likes Skiing lives next to the girl who plays Ten-pin bowlings. 22.Jessica wants to go to Australia.

input: The quiz was first published in 1962. We will change the original version slightly in the descriptions leaving the meaning as it is. There are five houses of different colors on the site: a red one, a green one, a blue one, a yellow one and a white one. There are five men of different nationalities living in them: an Englishman, a German, an Italian, a Spaniard, and a Chinese. These men grow the following berries in their gardens: raspberries, currants, gooseberries, strawberries, or grapes. Each of them has a pet: a dog, a cat, a parrot, a hamster, or fish. Each of them likes a certain brand of chocolate: Twix, Snickers, Mars, Bounty, Kitkat. Conditions of Einstein's riddle: 1. An Englishman lives in the red house. 2. A German owns a dog. 3. A man living in the green house plants raspberries. 4. An Italian plants grapes in his garden. 5. The green house is next to the white one to the right. 6. A man who likes Twix owns a cat. 7. A man living in the yellow house like Snickers. 8. There is a big variety of gooseberries in the central house. 9. A Spaniard lives in the house number one. 10. A parrot owner lives next to the Mars eater. 11. A man eating Snickers lives next to a man loving hamsters. 12. A man loving Kitkat and a man loving strawberries are the same person. 13. A chinese prefers Bounty to other chocolate brands. 14. A Spaniard's neighbor lives in the blue house. The question is: who owns fish and who plants currants?

instruction: Does the spaniard live in the house D ?
input: Five men with different nationalities and with different jobs live in consecutive houses on a street. The houses are painted different colors. The men have different pets and have different favorite drinks. Determine who owns a zebra and whose favorite drink is mineral water (which is one of the favorite drinks) given these clues: 1. The Englishman lives in the red house. 2. The Spaniard owns a dog. 3. The Japanese man is a painter. 4. The Italian drinks tea. 5. The Norwegian lives in the first house on the left. 6. The green house is on the right of the white one. 7. The photographer breeds snails. 8. The diplomat lives in the yellow house. 9. Milk is drunk in the middle house. 10. The owner of the green house drinks coffee. 11. The Norwegian's house is next to the blue one. 12. The violinist drinks orange juice. 13. The fox is in a house next to that of the physician. 14. The horse is in a house next to that of the diplomat.
